level.text: Before any optical scan voting equipment (“OSVE”) is used for deposit of voted ballots, the Precinct Captain shall:
Inspect the interior of the OSVE to show any voters and/or watchers that all ballot receiving areas are empty;
Secure and lock the ballot receiving areas of the OSVE;
Produce a zero-printout and, after ascertaining that vote totals opposite all voting positions are set at zero (0000), sign said printout; and
Inspect OSVE counter display to insure that it reads zero (0000).
From the time of the procedure specified in § 712.1 until the close of the polls, the polling official attending the OSVE shall ascertain that:
Only official ballots are deposited in the OSVE;
Nothing is removed from the OSVE; and
The secrecy of each voter’s ballot is preserved.
Each voter shall pass his or her voted paper ballot through the OSVE before leaving the early voting center or polling place.
Provision shall be made for maintaining the secrecy of the voted ballot while the voter carries it from voting booth to OSVE.
The OSVE’s shall be attended by a polling place official at all times, from the opening of the polls until the ballots, memory cards, or other electronic media are returned to the counting center.
